block.p: Myriamne Nicola Coffeen, the daughter of Dr. Yola E. Coffeen and Dr. David L. Coffeen of Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y., was married yesterday to Mark Hermann Vandeven, the son of Elisabeth and Donald W. Vandeven of Syracuse. Mayor Richard A. Watson of Morris Township, N.J., officiated at Silver Spring Farm, a restaurant in Flanders, N.J.

Ms. Coffeen-Vandeven, 36, was until March a marketer and a recruiter for Strategic Legal Resources, a placement agency in New York for lawyers and paralegals. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and the New York University School of Law. Her parents own Tesseract, a mail-order business in Hastings-on-Hudson that specializes in antique scientific and medical instruments. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

Myriamne Nicola Coffeen, the daughter of Dr. Yola E. Coffeen and Dr. David L. Coffeen of Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y., was married yesterday to Mark Hermann Vandeven, the son of Elisabeth and Donald W. Vandeven of Syracuse. Mayor Richard A. Watson of Morris Township, N.J., officiated at Silver Spring Farm, a restaurant in Flanders, N.J.

Ms. Coffeen-Vandeven, 36, was until March a marketer and a recruiter for Strategic Legal Resources, a placement agency in New York for lawyers and paralegals. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and the New York University School of Law. Her parents own Tesseract, a mail-order business in Hastings-on-Hudson that specializes in antique scientific and medical instruments. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

Mr. Vandeven, 39, is a senior statistical research associate at the Nabisco Research Center, the food company's research and development laboratory in East Hanover, N.J. He graduated from Penn and received a Ph.D. in statistics from the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. His mother retired as a special education teacher for the Syracuse public schools. His father, also retired, was an electrical engineer for Eastern Microwave, a communications engineering company in Syracuse.
